get.description: Gets a list of your media files. No query parameters are supported.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

parameters.name: Continuation-Token
parameters.description: Continuation token used to retrieve subsequent media.

Continuation-Token.description: Continuation token used to retrieve subsequent media.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/media' \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='

<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

try {
    $response = $messagingClient->listMedia($BW_ACCOUNT_ID);
    if (count($response->getResult()) > 0) {
        print_r($response->getResult()[0]->mediaName);
    }
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

try:
    response = messaging_client.list_media(BW_ACCOUNT_ID)
    print(response.body)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

begin
  media = messaging_client.list_media("12345")
  media.data.each { |item|
    puts item.media_name
  }
rescue APIException => e
  puts e.response_code
end

get.description: Downloads a media file you previously uploaded.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Media ID to retrieve

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/media/media-id-123' \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='

<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

$mediaFileName = "sample_media_file";

try {
    $response = $messagingClient->getMedia($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $mediaFileName);
    $downloadedMediaFile = $response->getResult();
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException
  
import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

media_file_name = 'sample_file_name'

try:
    response = messaging_client.get_media(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, media_file_name)
    downloaded_media_file = response.body
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

begin
  downloaded_media = messaging_client.get_media("12345", ENV['MEDIA_ID'])
  f = File.open("file_to_write", "wb")
  f.puts(downloaded_media.data)
  f.close()
rescue APIException => e
  puts e.response_code
end

put.description: Uploads a file the normal HTTP way. You may add headers to the request in order to provide some control to your media-file.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: The user supplied custom media ID

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the entity-body

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: General-header field is used to specify directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request/response chain.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/media/media-id-123' \
    -X PUT \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='

<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

$mediaFileName = "sample_file_name";
$mediaFile = "12345"; //Any binary string will work for the upload. This includes file contents

try {
    $messagingClient->uploadMedia($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $mediaFileName, $mediaFile);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

media_file_name = 'sample_file_name'
media_file = b'12345' #Any binary string will work for the upload. This includes file contents

try:
    messaging_client.upload_media(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, media_file_name, media_file)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

begin
  #f = File.open("some_file", "rb")
  #file_content = f.read
  file_content = "12345"
  messaging_client.upload_media(
    "12345",
    ENV['MEDIA_ID'],
    file_content,
    :content_type => "application/octet-stream",
    :cache_control => "no-cache"
  )
  f.close()
rescue APIException => e
  puts e.response_code
end

delete.description: Deletes a media file from Bandwidth API server. Make sure you don't have any application scripts still using the media before you delete. If you accidentally delete a media file, you can immediately upload a new file with the same name.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: The media ID to delete

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/media/media-id-123' \
    -X DELETE \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='

<?php
  
require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";
1234-asdf = "1234-asdf";
+15554443333 = "+15554443333";
+15553334444 = "+15553334444";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

$mediaId = "m-1234";

try {
    $messagingClient->deleteMedia($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $mediaId);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

media_id = "m-1234"

try:
    messaging_client.delete_media(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, media_id)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

begin
  messaging_client.delete_media("12345", ENV['MEDIA_ID'])
rescue APIException => e
  puts e.response_code
end

get.description: Gets a list of messages based on query parameters.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message to search for. Special characters need to be encoded using URL encoding

parameters.name: sourceTn
parameters.description: The phone number that sent the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number, a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10), or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters, e.g. '%2B1919')

parameters.name: destinationTn
parameters.description: The phone number that received the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number, a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10), or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters, e.g. '%2B1919')

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: The status of the message. One of RECEIVED, QUEUED, SENDING, SENT, FAILED, DELIVERED, ACCEPTED, UNDELIVERED

parameters.name: messageDirection
parameters.description: The direction of the message. One of INBOUND, OUTBOUND

parameters.name: carrierName
parameters.description: The name of the carrier used for this message. Possible values include, but are not limited to, Verizon and TMobile. Special characters need to be encoded using URL encoding (i.e. AT&T should be passed as AT%26T)

parameters.name: messageType
parameters.description: The type of the message. One of mms, sms

parameters.name: errorCode
parameters.description: The error code of the message

parameters.name: fromDateTime
parameters.description: The start of the date range to search in ISO 8601 format. Uses the message receive time. The date range to search in is currently 14 days.

parameters.name: toDateTime
parameters.description: The end of the date range to search in ISO 8601 format. Uses the message receive time. The date range to search in is currently 14 days.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field and direction to sort by, combined with a colon. Direction is one of asc, desc

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A base64 encoded value used for pagination of results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum records requested in search result. Default 100. The sum of limit and after cannot be more than 10000

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/messages?sourceTn=+15554443333' \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='

<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";
+15554443333 = "+15554443333";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

try {
    $response = $messagingClient->getMessages($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $sourceTn = $BW_NUMBER);
    print_r($response->getResult()->totalCount);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

source_tn = "+15554443333"

try:
    response = messaging_client.get_messages(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, source_tn=source_tn)
    print(response.body.total_count)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

begin
  result = messaging_client.get_messages("12345", :source_tn => "+15554443333")
  puts result.data.total_count
rescue APIException => e
  puts e.response_code
end

post.description: Endpoint for sending text messages and picture messages using V2 messaging.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: User's account ID

x-codeSamples.source:
curl 'https://messaging.bandwidth.com/api/v2/users/12345/messages' \
    -X POST \
    -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ=' \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d '{
        "applicationId": "$BW_ACCOUNT_ID",
        "to": [
            "+15553334444",
            "+15552223333"
        ],
        "from": "+15554443333",
        "text": "Hello World!",
        "media": [
            "https://dev.bandwidth.com/images/bandwidth-logo.png",
            "https://dev.bandwidth.com/images/github_logo.png"
        ],
        "tag": "custom string",
        "priority": "default"
    }'

<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";
1234-asdf = "1234-asdf";
+15554443333 = "+15554443333";
+15553334444 = "+15553334444";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$messagingClient = $client->getMessaging()->getClient();

$body = new BandwidthLib\Messaging\Models\MessageRequest();
$body->from = $BW_NUMBER;
$body->to = array($USER_NUMBER);
$body->applicationId = $BW_MESSAGING_APPLICATION_ID;
$body->text = "Hello world";

try {
    $response = $messagingClient->createMessage($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $body);
    print_r($response->getResult()->id);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.messaging.models.message_request import MessageRequest
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"
BW_MESSAGING_APPLICATION_ID = "1234-asdf"
BW_NUMBER = "+15554443333"
USER_NUMBER = "+15553334444"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    messaging_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

body = MessageRequest()
body.application_id = BW_MESSAGING_APPLICATION_ID
body.to = [USER_NUMBER]
body.mfrom = BW_NUMBER
body.text = "Hello world"
try:
    response = messaging_client.create_message(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, body)
    print(response.body.id)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'

include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Messaging

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    messaging_basic_auth_user_name: "api-username",
    messaging_basic_auth_password: "api-password"
)
messaging_client = bandwidth_client.messaging_client.client

body = MessageRequest.new
body.application_id = "1234-asdf" # test
body.to = ["+15553334444"]
body.from = "+15554443333"
body.text = 'Hey, check this out!'
body.tag = '{"test": "message"}'
begin
    result = messaging_client.create_message("12345", body)
    puts 'messageId: ' + result.data.id
rescue APIException => e
    puts e.response_code
end

totalCount.description: Total number of messages matched by the search

accountId.description: The account id of the message

sourceTn.description: The source phone number of the message

destinationTn.description: The recipient phone number of the message

messageDirection.description: The direction of the message relative to Bandwidth. INBOUND or OUTBOUND

messageType.description: The type of message. sms or mms

segmentCount.description: The number of segments the message was sent as

errorCode.description: The numeric error code of the message

receiveTime.description: The ISO 8601 datetime of the message

carrierName.description: The name of the carrier. Not currently supported for MMS, coming soon

messageSize.description: The size of the message including message content and headers

messageLength.description: The length of the message content

attachmentCount.description: The number of attachments the message has

recipientCount.description: The number of recipients the message has

campaignClass.description: The campaign class of the message, if it has one

prevPage.description: The link to the previous page for pagination

nextPage.description: The link to the next page for pagination

prevPageToken.description: The isolated pagination token for the previous page

nextPageToken.description: The isolated pagination token for the next page

owner.description: The Bandwidth phone number associated with the message

applicationId.description: The application ID associated with the message

time.description: The datetime stamp of the message in ISO 8601

segmentCount.description: The number of segments the original message from the user is broken into before sending over to carrier networks

direction.description: The direction of the message relative to Bandwidth. Can be in or out

to.description: The phone number recipients of the message

from.description: The phone number the message was sent from

media.description: The list of media URLs sent in the message. Including a `filename` field in the `Content-Disposition` header of the media linked with a URL will set the displayed file name. This is a best practice to ensure that your media has a readable file name.

tag.description: The custom string set by the user

priority.description: The priority specified by the user

applicationId.description: The ID of the Application your from number is associated with in the Bandwidth Phone Number Dashboard.

to.description: The phone number(s) the message should be sent to in E164 format

from.description: One of your telephone numbers the message should come from in E164 format

text.description: The contents of the text message. Must be 2048 characters or less.

media.description: A list of URLs to include as media attachments as part of the message.

tag.description: A custom string that will be included in callback events of the message. Max 1024 characters

priority.description: The message's priority, currently for toll-free or short code SMS only. Messages with a priority value of `"high"` are given preference over your other traffic.

Unauthorized.description: 401 The specified user does not have access to the account

Forbidden.description: 403 The user does not have access to this API

InvalidMediaType.description: 415 The content-type of the request is incorrect

TooManyRequests.description: 429 The rate limit has been reached
